course: Introduction to Data Science with Beginning R and Python

scenario.title: Senior Undergraduate (Psychology)
scenario.description: Elena is a senior psychology student who is curious about data science. She wants exposure to R and Python to strengthen graduate school applications and improve her research toolkit. She has limited budget and moderate urgency.

expectations: An engaging, exploratory introduction with credible instruction, hands-on projects she can showcase, and clear guidance on next steps for graduate study or early research roles.

actions: Hears from a professor that coding strengthens research skills.
Searches for beginner R courses and reads NC State program page.
Skims student reviews and program outcomes.
pains: Unsure whether time and cost will pay off.

feelings.quote: This could open new doors, but I’m not sure yet.

opportunities: Position the course as a low-risk exploration with strong fundamentals.
Show example student projects and academic use cases.

actions: Compares NC State with Coursera and DataCamp for cost and credibility.
Checks if there are student discounts or scholarships.
pains: Concern about affordability versus cheaper platforms.
Unsure whether academic credit or certificate matters for her.

feelings.quote: If I’m going to spend, I want it to be credible.

opportunities: Offer student pricing and highlight recognized certificates.
Clarify transferability of skills and next-course pathways.

actions: Registers and pays out of pocket.
Adds course dates to calendar and informs advisor.
pains: Budget constraints and buyer’s remorse risk.

feelings.quote: I hope this will be worth the sacrifice.

opportunities: Flexible refund/deferral options and try-before-commit messaging.
Pre-course orientation to confirm fit and expectations.

actions: Completes hands-on labs using psychology-relevant datasets.
Shares projects with peers and seeks feedback.
Explores optional readings on research methods.
pains: Competing academic workload causes dips in momentum.

feelings.quote: This is fun, but I’m not sure I’ll stick with it.

opportunities: Light gamification, peer challenges, and recognition of milestones.
Advising on graduate-school pathways and research assistant roles.
